newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end lower on light selling.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end lower on light selling.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures ended lower across the board on Friday due to light selling from individual investors stimulated by the fall overnight in Chicago, traders said.
Prices ranged from 70 to 290 yen per tonne lower at the close, with benchmark May 1998 ending 70 yen down at 13,850.
The day's estimated trade volume was 39,163 lots.
Investors were reluctant to build positions ahead of the long weekend in the U.S., they said.
At 0750 GMT, the spot July corn contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was $2.73 per bushel, down from the $2.73-1/4 Thursday close.
The spot July soybean contract on the CBOT overnight trading system stood at $8.42 per bushel, against $8.46-1/2 at Thursday's close.
